thread.title: May tells U.S. President Trump of 'deep concern' over metals tariffs

title: May tells U.S. President Trump of 'deep concern' over metals tariffs
text: March 4, 2018 / 4:10 PM / Updated 5 hours ago May tells U.S. President Trump of 'deep concern' over metals tariffs Reuters Staff 1 Min Read LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister Theresa May told U.S. President Donald Trump she had“deep concern” about the expected announcement of U.S. tariffs on aluminium and steel, May’s office said on Sunday following a phone call between the two leaders. Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May delivers a speech about her vision for Brexit, at Mansion House in London, Britain, March 2, 2018. REUTERS/Leon Neal/Pool “The Prime Minister raised our deep concern at the President’s forthcoming announcement on steel and aluminium tariffs, noting that multilateral action was the only way to resolve the problem of global overcapacity in all parties’ interests,” a spokeswoman from May’s office said. Reporting by William James; Editing by Alexander Smith
